comments.text:
"The search terms used are sent to Mozilla (Privacy Policy) and to 3rd party email providers Hover.com (Privacy Policy, Terms of Service) to find available email addresses."

This reads a little oddly.

comments.text: Yeah, if you could give me a bit more context, I'd be happy to help. As it is, I'm not sure where that appears or even exactly what it's trying to say. Thanks!

comments.creator: ludovic@hirlimann.net
comments.text:
(In reply to Matej Novak [:matej] from comment #2)
> Yeah, if you could give me a bit more context, I'd be happy to help. As it
> is, I'm not sure where that appears or even exactly what it's trying to say.
> Thanks!

When you launch Thunderbird for the first time with a clean profile and you want to create an email address this is the text you get. From a running Thunderbird installation do the following to see the text :

File -> New -> Get New mail account 
A nice windows open with a click here text . click on here and see the text mike si refereing to in comment #0
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Matej Novak [:matej] from comment #2)
> Yeah, if you could give me a bit more context, I'd be happy to help. As it
> is, I'm not sure where that appears or even exactly what it's trying to say.
> Thanks!

When you launch Thunderbird for the first time with a clean profile and you want to create an email address this is the text you get. From a running Thunderbird installation do the following to see the text :

File -> New -> Get New mail account 
A nice windows open with a click here text . click on here and see the text mike si refereing to in comment #0

I think this helps a bit:

"The search terms entered above are sent to Mozilla (Privacy Policy) and to the 3rd-party email provider Hover.com (Privacy Policy, Terms of Service) to find email addresses available for use."
